title: Linux mpstat Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux mpstat command, a powerful tool for monitoring and analyzing CPU utilization metrics across multiple CPUs. Learn how to use mpstat to gain insights into system performance and optimize resource allocation.

meta.title: Linux mpstat Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux mpstat command, a powerful tool for monitoring and analyzing CPU utilization metrics across multiple CPUs. Learn how to use mpstat to gain insights into system performance and optimize resource allocation.
meta.keywords: Linux, mpstat, CPU utilization, system monitoring, performance analysis, resource optimization

steps.title: Understand the Purpose and Usage of mpstat Command

verify.name: Verify mpstat command usage
verify.hint: Ensure that you have run the `mpstat` command and that it has output the expected CPU utilization metrics, including the `%usr`, `%sys`, and `%idle` columns.

steps.title: Explore CPU Utilization Metrics with mpstat

verify.name: Verify mpstat CPU utilization metrics
verify.hint: Ensure that you have run the `mpstat -P ALL` command and that it has output the CPU utilization metrics for each individual CPU, including the `%usr`, `%sys`, and `%idle` columns.

steps.title: Analyze CPU Performance Across Multiple CPUs

verify.name: Verify mpstat CPU performance analysis
verify.hint: Ensure that you have run the `mpstat -P ALL` command and that it has output the CPU utilization metrics for each individual CPU, including the `%usr`, `%sys`, and `%idle` columns.
